meanings.definition: Premies: plural noun, short for premature babies
meanings.sent1: The hospital had a special unit for premies born before their due date.
meanings.sent2: The premies in the neonatal ward were receiving excellent care.
meanings.sent3: The tiny premies in the incubators looked like little fighters.
meanings.sent4: The love and attention given to premies can make a big difference in their development.
meanings.sent5: The doctor's expertise in caring for premies was truly remarkable.

meanings.definition: Premies: verb, present tense of the word premie
meanings.sent1: The nurse premies the formula before feeding the baby.
meanings.sent2: She always premies the clothes before putting them in the dryer.
meanings.sent3: I premies my lunch bag every morning to make sure I have everything I need.
meanings.sent4: The chef carefully premies the ingredients before starting to cook.
meanings.sent5: Remember to premies your work before submitting it for review.

meanings.definition: Premies: adjective, describing something related to premature birth
meanings.sent1: The premies support group provided valuable resources for parents of premature babies.
meanings.sent2: Her premies experience as a preemie herself helped her connect with the newborn's parents.
meanings.sent3: The premies clothing line specialized in outfits for tiny newborns.
meanings.sent4: The premies care package included essentials for families with premature infants.
meanings.sent5: The premies unit at the hospital was equipped with state-of-the-art technology.
